phylojunction.pgm.pgm module

class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.ConstantFn

Bases: ValueGenerator

Class for deterministically generating values.

An object is class whenever user input must be parsed and modified before it can be stored in a DAG node.

abstract property CT_FN_NAME
class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.DeterministicNodeDAG(node_name: str, value: Optional[List[Any]] = None, call_order_idx: Optional[int] = None, deterministic: bool = True, parent_nodes: Optional[List[NodeDAG]] = None)

Bases: NodeDAG

Derived DAG node that holds value dependent on another node’s.

Deterministic node values depend deterministically on those from parent nodes. These nodes are used to modify and annotate stochastic node values.

class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.DistrForSampling

Bases: ValueGenerator

Class for randomly generating (i.e., sampling) values.

An object of this class is required by stochastic DAG nodes so values can be sampled.

abstract property DN_NAME: str
class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.NodeDAG(node_name: str, sample_size: Optional[int], replicate_size: int = 1, value: Optional[List[Any]] = None, call_order_idx: Optional[int] = None, sampled: bool = False, deterministic: bool = False, clamped: bool = False, parent_nodes: Optional[List[NodeDAG]] = None)

Bases: ABC

Node class for building directed acyclic graphs (DAGs).

This class has abstract methods, so it cannot be instantiated. It is derived by StochasticNodeDAG and DeterministicNodeDAG

node_name

Name of the node, e.g., ‘lambda’.

Type:str
sample_size

How many samples (simulations) to be either drawn or specified for the node.

Type:int
replicate_size

How many replicates (for each sample) to be drawn or specified the node. This is the size of a ‘plate’ in graphical notation. Defaults to 1.

Type:int
value

List of values associated to node. Defaults to None.

Type:object
call_order_idx

The order at which this node was added to DAG. If it is the first node of the DAG, for example, this value is 1. Defaults to None.

Type:int
sampled

Flag specifying if what the ‘value’ attribute

Type:bool
stores are stochastic samples from a distribution. Defaults to

‘False’.

deterministic

Flag specifying if what the ‘value’ attribute stores is the output of a deterministic function. Defaults to ‘False’.

Type:bool
clamped

Flag specifying if what the ‘value’ attribute stores is observed (i.e., data). Defaults to ‘False’.

Type:bool
parent_nodes

List of (parent) NodeDAG objects that are in the path between this node and the outermost layer in the DAG. Defaults to None.

Type:NodeDAG
call_order_idx: int

class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.StochasticNodeDAG(node_name: str, sample_size: int, sampled_from: Optional[DistrForSampling] = None, returned_from: Optional[ConstantFn] = None, value: Optional[List[Any]] = None, replicate_size: int = 1, call_order_idx: Optional[int] = None, deterministic: bool = False, clamped: bool = False, parent_nodes: Optional[List[Any]] = None)

Bases: NodeDAG

Derived DAG node that can generate own value.

This class is also used when a value is being specified by a user, or parsed from it. In other words, constant nodes in the graph are still stochastic DAG nodes under the hood.

sampling_dn

Distribution object for randomly sampling values.

Type:DistrForSampling
constant_fn

Function object for obtaining constant values modified from some user input.

Type:ConstantFn
operator_weight

Weight given to MCMC move.

Type:float
constant_fn: Optional[ConstantFn]
generate_value() → List[Any]

Generate value.

get_node_stats_str(start: int, end: int, repl_idx: int) → str
operator_weight: float
plot_node(axes: Axes, sample_idx: int = 0, repl_idx: int = 0, repl_size: int = 1, branch_attr: str = 'state') → None

Plot node (side-effect) on provided Axes object

Parameters:
  • axes (matplotlib.pyplot.Axes) – Axes object where we are drawing the tree.
  • sample_idx (int) – Which sample to plot. Defaults to 0.
  • repl_idx (int) – Which replicate to plot (one replicated is plotted at a time). Defaults to 0.
  • repl_size (int) – How many scalar random variables to plot at a time. Defaults to 1.
  • branch_attr (str, optional) – If tree, which branch attribute to color branch according to. Defaults to ‘state’.
populate_operator_weight() → None
sampling_dn: Optional[DistrForSampling]

This is the function behind the vectorization functionality

n_repl()
n_samples()
phylojunction.pgm.pgm.abstract_attribute(obj: Optional[Callable[[Any], R]] = None) → R
phylojunction.pgm.pgm.extract_vals_as_str_from_node_dag(val_list: List[Union[NodeDAG, str]]) → List[str]

Get values from DAG node.

If all elements are strings, returns copy of ‘val_list’. When elements are StochasticNodeDAGs, replaces those objects by their values after casting to string (their values must be within a list).

Raises:VariableMisspec – Is raised if DAG node does not have a value or if it cannot be string-fied.
Returns:List of values as strings.
Return type:(str)
